00098 /* ************************ Constraints - General Utilities *************************** */
00099 /* These functions here don't act on any specific constraints, and are therefore should/will
00100  * not require any of the special function-pointers afforded by the relevant constraint 
00101  * type-info structs.
00102  */
00103 
00104 /* -------------- Naming -------------- */
00105 
00106 /* Find the first available, non-duplicate name for a given constraint */
00107 void unique_constraint_name (bConstraint *con, ListBase *list)
00108 {
00109     BLI_uniquename(list, con, "Const", '.', offsetof(bConstraint, name), sizeof(con->name));
00110 }

00112 /* ----------------- Evaluation Loop Preparation --------------- */
00113 
00114 /* package an object/bone for use in constraint evaluation */
00115 /* This function MEM_calloc's a bConstraintOb struct, that will need to be freed after evaluation */
00116 bConstraintOb *constraints_make_evalob (Scene *scene, Object *ob, void *subdata, short datatype)
00117 {
00118     bConstraintOb *cob;
00119     
00120     /* create regardless of whether we have any data! */
00121     cob= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bConstraintOb), "bConstraintOb");
00122     
00123     /* for system time, part of deglobalization, code nicer later with local time (ton) */
00124     cob->scene= scene;
00125     
00126     /* based on type of available data */
00127     switch (datatype) {
00128         case CONSTRAINT_OBTYPE_OBJECT:
00129         {
00130             /* disregard subdata... calloc should set other values right */
00131             if (ob) {
00132                 cob->ob = ob;
00133                 cob->type = datatype;
00134                 cob->rotOrder = EULER_ORDER_DEFAULT; // TODO: when objects have rotation order too, use that
00135                 copy_m4_m4(cob->matrix, ob->obmat);
00136             }
00137             else
00138                 unit_m4(cob->matrix);
00139             
00140             copy_m4_m4(cob->startmat, cob->matrix);
00141         }
00142             break;
00143         case CONSTRAINT_OBTYPE_BONE:
00144         {
00145             /* only set if we have valid bone, otherwise default */
00146             if (ob && subdata) {
00147                 cob->ob = ob;
00148                 cob->pchan = (bPoseChannel *)subdata;
00149                 cob->type = datatype;
00150                 
00151                 if (cob->pchan->rotmode > 0) {
00152                     /* should be some type of Euler order */
00153                     cob->rotOrder= cob->pchan->rotmode; 
00154                 }
00155                 else {
00156                     /* Quats, so eulers should just use default order */
00157                     cob->rotOrder= EULER_ORDER_DEFAULT;
00158                 }
00159                 
00160                 /* matrix in world-space */
00161                 mult_m4_m4m4(cob->matrix, ob->obmat, cob->pchan->pose_mat);
00162             }
00163             else
00164                 unit_m4(cob->matrix);
00165                 
00166             copy_m4_m4(cob->startmat, cob->matrix);
00167         }
00168             break;
00169             
00170         default: /* other types not yet handled */
00171             unit_m4(cob->matrix);
00172             unit_m4(cob->startmat);
00173             break;
00174     }
00175     
00176     return cob;
00177 }
00178 
00179 /* cleanup after constraint evaluation */
00180 void constraints_clear_evalob (bConstraintOb *cob)
00181 {
00182     float delta[4][4], imat[4][4];
00183     
00184     /* prevent crashes */
00185     if (cob == NULL) 
00186         return;
00187     
00188     /* calculate delta of constraints evaluation */
00189     invert_m4_m4(imat, cob->startmat);
00190     mult_m4_m4m4(delta, cob->matrix, imat);
00191     
00192     /* copy matrices back to source */
00193     switch (cob->type) {
00194         case CONSTRAINT_OBTYPE_OBJECT:
00195         {
00196             /* cob->ob might not exist! */
00197             if (cob->ob) {
00198                 /* copy new ob-matrix back to owner */
00199                 copy_m4_m4(cob->ob->obmat, cob->matrix);
00200                 
00201                 /* copy inverse of delta back to owner */
00202                 invert_m4_m4(cob->ob->constinv, delta);
00203             }
00204         }
00205             break;
00206         case CONSTRAINT_OBTYPE_BONE:
00207         {
00208             /* cob->ob or cob->pchan might not exist */
00209             if (cob->ob && cob->pchan) {
00210                 /* copy new pose-matrix back to owner */
00211                 mult_m4_m4m4(cob->pchan->pose_mat, cob->ob->imat, cob->matrix);
00212                 
00213                 /* copy inverse of delta back to owner */
00214                 invert_m4_m4(cob->pchan->constinv, delta);
00215             }
00216         }
00217             break;
00218     }
00219     
00220     /* free tempolary struct */
00221     MEM_freeN(cob);
00222 }

00226 #if 0 /* XXX Old code, does the same as one in armature.c, will remove it later. */
00227 static void constraint_pchan_diff_mat(bPoseChannel *pchan, float diff_mat[4][4])
00228 {
00229     if (pchan->parent) {
00230         float offs_bone[4][4];
00231 
00232         /* construct offs_bone the same way it is done in armature.c */
00233         copy_m4_m3(offs_bone, pchan->bone->bone_mat);
00234         copy_v3_v3(offs_bone[3], pchan->bone->head);
00235         offs_bone[3][1] += pchan->bone->parent->length;
00236 
00237         if (pchan->bone->flag & BONE_HINGE) {
00238             /* pose_mat = par_pose-space_location * chan_mat */
00239             float tmat[4][4];
00240 
00241             /* the rotation of the parent restposition */
00242             copy_m4_m4(tmat, pchan->bone->parent->arm_mat);
00243 
00244             /* the location of actual parent transform */
00245             copy_v3_v3(tmat[3], offs_bone[3]);
00246             zero_v3(offs_bone[3]);
00247             mul_m4_v3(pchan->parent->pose_mat, tmat[3]);
00248 
00249             mult_m4_m4m4(diff_mat, tmat, offs_bone);
00250         }
00251         else {
00252             /* pose_mat = par_pose_mat * bone_mat * chan_mat */
00253             if (pchan->bone->flag & BONE_NO_SCALE) {
00254                 float tmat[4][4];
00255                 copy_m4_m4(tmat, pchan->parent->pose_mat);
00256                 normalize_m4(tmat);
00257                 mult_m4_m4m4(diff_mat, tmat, offs_bone);
00258             }
00259             else {
00260                 mult_m4_m4m4(diff_mat, pchan->parent->pose_mat, offs_bone);
00261             }
00262         }
00263     }
00264     else {
00265         /* pose_mat = chan_mat * arm_mat */
00266         copy_m4_m4(diff_mat, pchan->bone->arm_mat);
00267     }
00268 }
00269 #endif
00270 
00271 /* This function is responsible for the correct transformations/conversions 
00272  * of a matrix from one space to another for constraint evaluation.
00273  * For now, this is only implemented for Objects and PoseChannels.
00274  */
00275 void constraint_mat_convertspace (Object *ob, bPoseChannel *pchan, float mat[][4], short from, short to)
00276 {
00277     float diff_mat[4][4];
00278     float imat[4][4];
00279     
00280     /* prevent crashes in these unlikely events  */
00281     if (ob==NULL || mat==NULL) return;
00282     /* optimize trick - check if need to do anything */
00283     if (from == to) return;
00284     
00285     /* are we dealing with pose-channels or objects */
00286     if (pchan) {
00287         /* pose channels */
00288         switch (from) {
00289             case CONSTRAINT_SPACE_WORLD: /* ---------- FROM WORLDSPACE ---------- */
00290             {
00291                 /* world to pose */
00292                 invert_m4_m4(imat, ob->obmat);
00293                 mult_m4_m4m4(mat, imat, mat);
00294                 
00295                 /* use pose-space as stepping stone for other spaces... */
00296                 if (ELEM(to, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_LOCAL, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_PARLOCAL)) {
00297                     /* call self with slightly different values */
00298                     constraint_mat_convertspace(ob, pchan, mat, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_POSE, to);
00299                 }
00300             }
00301                 break;
00302             case CONSTRAINT_SPACE_POSE: /* ---------- FROM POSESPACE ---------- */
00303             {
00304                 /* pose to world */
00305                 if (to == CONSTRAINT_SPACE_WORLD) {
00306                     mult_m4_m4m4(mat, ob->obmat, mat);
00307                 }
00308                 /* pose to local */
00309                 else if (to == CONSTRAINT_SPACE_LOCAL) {
00310                     if (pchan->bone) {
00311                         armature_mat_pose_to_bone(pchan, mat, mat);
00312 #if 0  /* XXX Old code, will remove it later. */
00313                         constraint_pchan_diff_mat(pchan, diff_mat);
00314 
00315                         invert_m4_m4(imat, diff_mat);
00316                         mult_m4_m4m4(mat, imat, mat);
00317 
00318                         /* override with local location */
00319                         if ((pchan->parent) && (pchan->bone->flag & BONE_NO_LOCAL_LOCATION)) {
00320                             armature_mat_pose_to_bone_ex(ob, pchan, pchan->pose_mat, tempmat);
00321                             copy_v3_v3(mat[3], tempmat[3]);
00322                         }
00323 #endif
00324                     }
00325                 }
00326                 /* pose to local with parent */
00327                 else if (to == CONSTRAINT_SPACE_PARLOCAL) {
00328                     if (pchan->bone) {
00329                         invert_m4_m4(imat, pchan->bone->arm_mat);
00330                         mult_m4_m4m4(mat, imat, mat);
00331                     }
00332                 }
00333             }
00334                 break;
00335             case CONSTRAINT_SPACE_LOCAL: /* ------------ FROM LOCALSPACE --------- */
00336             {
00337                 /* local to pose - do inverse procedure that was done for pose to local */
00338                 if (pchan->bone) {
00339                     /* we need the posespace_matrix = local_matrix + (parent_posespace_matrix + restpos) */
00340                     armature_mat_bone_to_pose(pchan, mat, mat);
00341 #if 0
00342                     constraint_pchan_diff_mat(pchan, diff_mat);
00343 
00344                     mult_m4_m4m4(mat, diff_mat, mat);
00345 #endif
00346                 }
00347                 
00348                 /* use pose-space as stepping stone for other spaces */
00349                 if (ELEM(to, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_WORLD, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_PARLOCAL)) {
00350                     /* call self with slightly different values */
00351                     constraint_mat_convertspace(ob, pchan, mat, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_POSE, to);
00352                 }               
00353             }
00354                 break;
00355             case CONSTRAINT_SPACE_PARLOCAL: /* -------------- FROM LOCAL WITH PARENT ---------- */
00356             {
00357                 /* local + parent to pose */
00358                 if (pchan->bone) {                  
00359                     copy_m4_m4(diff_mat, pchan->bone->arm_mat);
00360                     mult_m4_m4m4(mat, mat, diff_mat);
00361                 }
00362                 
00363                 /* use pose-space as stepping stone for other spaces */
00364                 if (ELEM(to, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_WORLD, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_LOCAL)) {
00365                     /* call self with slightly different values */
00366                     constraint_mat_convertspace(ob, pchan, mat, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_POSE, to);
00367                 }
00368             }
00369                 break;
00370         }
00371     }
00372     else {
00373         /* objects */
00374         if (from==CONSTRAINT_SPACE_WORLD && to==CONSTRAINT_SPACE_LOCAL) {
00375             /* check if object has a parent */
00376             if (ob->parent) {
00377                 /* 'subtract' parent's effects from owner */
00378                 mult_m4_m4m4(diff_mat, ob->parent->obmat, ob->parentinv);
00379                 invert_m4_m4(imat, diff_mat);
00380                 mult_m4_m4m4(mat, imat, mat);
00381             }
00382             else {
00383                 /* Local space in this case will have to be defined as local to the owner's 
00384                  * transform-property-rotated axes. So subtract this rotation component.
00385                  */
00386                 object_to_mat4(ob, diff_mat);
00387                 normalize_m4(diff_mat);
00388                 zero_v3(diff_mat[3]);
00389                 
00390                 invert_m4_m4(imat, diff_mat);
00391                 mult_m4_m4m4(mat, imat, mat);
00392             }
00393         }
00394         else if (from==CONSTRAINT_SPACE_LOCAL && to==CONSTRAINT_SPACE_WORLD) {
00395             /* check that object has a parent - otherwise this won't work */
00396             if (ob->parent) {
00397                 /* 'add' parent's effect back to owner */
00398                 mult_m4_m4m4(diff_mat, ob->parent->obmat, ob->parentinv);
00399                 mult_m4_m4m4(mat, diff_mat, mat);
00400             }
00401             else {
00402                 /* Local space in this case will have to be defined as local to the owner's 
00403                  * transform-property-rotated axes. So add back this rotation component.
00404                  */
00405                 object_to_mat4(ob, diff_mat);
00406                 normalize_m4(diff_mat);
00407                 zero_v3(diff_mat[3]);
00408                 
00409                 mult_m4_m4m4(mat, diff_mat, mat);
00410             }
00411         }
00412     }
00413 }

00415 /* ------------ General Target Matrix Tools ---------- */
00416 
00417 /* function that sets the given matrix based on given vertex group in mesh */
00418 static void contarget_get_mesh_mat (Object *ob, const char *substring, float mat[][4])
00419 {
00420     DerivedMesh *dm = NULL;
00421     Mesh *me= ob->data;
00422     BMEditMesh *em = me->edit_btmesh;
00423     float vec[3] = {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f};
00424     float normal[3] = {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f}, plane[3];
00425     float imat[3][3], tmat[3][3];
00426     const int defgroup= defgroup_name_index(ob, substring);
00427     short freeDM = 0;
00428     
00429     /* initialize target matrix using target matrix */
00430     copy_m4_m4(mat, ob->obmat);
00431     
00432     /* get index of vertex group */
00433     if (defgroup == -1) return;
00434 
00435     /* get DerivedMesh */
00436     if (em) {
00437         /* target is in editmode, so get a special derived mesh */
00438         dm = CDDM_from_BMEditMesh(em, ob->data, FALSE, FALSE);
00439         freeDM= 1;
00440     }
00441     else {
00442         /* when not in EditMode, use the 'final' derived mesh, depsgraph
00443          * ensures we build with CD_MDEFORMVERT layer 
00444          */
00445         dm = (DerivedMesh *)ob->derivedFinal;
00446     }
00447     
00448     /* only continue if there's a valid DerivedMesh */
00449     if (dm) {
00450         MDeformVert *dvert = dm->getVertDataArray(dm, CD_MDEFORMVERT);
00451         int numVerts = dm->getNumVerts(dm);
00452         int i, count = 0;
00453         float co[3], nor[3];
00454         
00455         /* check that dvert is a valid pointers (just in case) */
00456         if (dvert) {
00457             MDeformVert *dv= dvert;
00458             /* get the average of all verts with that are in the vertex-group */
00459             for (i = 0; i < numVerts; i++, dv++) {
00460                 MDeformWeight *dw= defvert_find_index(dv, defgroup);
00461                 if (dw && dw->weight != 0.0f) {
00462                     dm->getVertCo(dm, i, co);
00463                     dm->getVertNo(dm, i, nor);
00464                     add_v3_v3(vec, co);
00465                     add_v3_v3(normal, nor);
00466                     count++;
00467                     
00468                 }
00469             }
00470 
00471             /* calculate averages of normal and coordinates */
00472             if (count > 0) {
00473                 mul_v3_fl(vec, 1.0f / count);
00474                 mul_v3_fl(normal, 1.0f / count);
00475             }
00476             
00477             
00478             /* derive the rotation from the average normal: 
00479              *      - code taken from transform_manipulator.c, 
00480              *          calc_manipulator_stats, V3D_MANIP_NORMAL case
00481              */
00482             /*  we need the transpose of the inverse for a normal... */
00483             copy_m3_m4(imat, ob->obmat);
00484             
00485             invert_m3_m3(tmat, imat);
00486             transpose_m3(tmat);
00487             mul_m3_v3(tmat, normal);
00488             
00489             normalize_v3(normal);
00490             copy_v3_v3(plane, tmat[1]);
00491             
00492             cross_v3_v3v3(mat[0], normal, plane);
00493             if (len_v3(mat[0]) < 1e-3f) {
00494                 copy_v3_v3(plane, tmat[0]);
00495                 cross_v3_v3v3(mat[0], normal, plane);
00496             }
00497 
00498             copy_v3_v3(mat[2], normal);
00499             cross_v3_v3v3(mat[1], mat[2], mat[0]);
00500 
00501             normalize_m4(mat);
00502 
00503             
00504             /* apply the average coordinate as the new location */
00505             mul_v3_m4v3(mat[3], ob->obmat, vec);
00506         }
00507     }
00508     
00509     /* free temporary DerivedMesh created (in EditMode case) */
00510     if (dm && freeDM)
00511         dm->release(dm);
00512 }
00513 
00514 /* function that sets the given matrix based on given vertex group in lattice */
00515 static void contarget_get_lattice_mat (Object *ob, const char *substring, float mat[][4])
00516 {
00517     Lattice *lt= (Lattice *)ob->data;
00518     
00519     DispList *dl = find_displist(&ob->disp, DL_VERTS);
00520     float *co = dl?dl->verts:NULL;
00521     BPoint *bp = lt->def;
00522     
00523     MDeformVert *dv = lt->dvert;
00524     int tot_verts= lt->pntsu*lt->pntsv*lt->pntsw;
00525     float vec[3]= {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f}, tvec[3];
00526     int grouped=0;
00527     int i, n;
00528     const int defgroup= defgroup_name_index(ob, substring);
00529     
00530     /* initialize target matrix using target matrix */
00531     copy_m4_m4(mat, ob->obmat);
00532 
00533     /* get index of vertex group */
00534     if (defgroup == -1) return;
00535     if (dv == NULL) return;
00536     
00537     /* 1. Loop through control-points checking if in nominated vertex-group.
00538      * 2. If it is, add it to vec to find the average point.
00539      */
00540     for (i=0; i < tot_verts; i++, dv++) {
00541         for (n= 0; n < dv->totweight; n++) {
00542             MDeformWeight *dw= defvert_find_index(dv, defgroup);
00543             if (dw && dw->weight > 0.0f) {
00544                 /* copy coordinates of point to temporary vector, then add to find average */
00545                 memcpy(tvec, co ? co : bp->vec, 3 * sizeof(float));
00546 
00547                 add_v3_v3(vec, tvec);
00548                 grouped++;
00549             }
00550         }
00551         
00552         /* advance pointer to coordinate data */
00553         if (co) co += 3;
00554         else    bp++;
00555     }
00556     
00557     /* find average location, then multiply by ob->obmat to find world-space location */
00558     if (grouped)
00559         mul_v3_fl(vec, 1.0f / grouped);
00560     mul_v3_m4v3(tvec, ob->obmat, vec);
00561     
00562     /* copy new location to matrix */
00563     copy_v3_v3(mat[3], tvec);
00564 }
00565 
00566 /* generic function to get the appropriate matrix for most target cases */
00567 /* The cases where the target can be object data have not been implemented */
00568 static void constraint_target_to_mat4 (Object *ob, const char *substring, float mat[][4], short from, short to, float headtail)
00569 {
00570     /*  Case OBJECT */
00571     if (!strlen(substring)) {
00572         copy_m4_m4(mat, ob->obmat);
00573         constraint_mat_convertspace(ob, NULL, mat, from, to);
00574     }
00575     /*  Case VERTEXGROUP */
00576     /* Current method just takes the average location of all the points in the
00577      * VertexGroup, and uses that as the location value of the targets. Where 
00578      * possible, the orientation will also be calculated, by calculating an
00579      * 'average' vertex normal, and deriving the rotation from that.
00580      *
00581      * NOTE: EditMode is not currently supported, and will most likely remain that
00582      *      way as constraints can only really affect things on object/bone level.
00583      */
00584     else if (ob->type == OB_MESH) {
00585         contarget_get_mesh_mat(ob, substring, mat);
00586         constraint_mat_convertspace(ob, NULL, mat, from, to);
00587     }
00588     else if (ob->type == OB_LATTICE) {
00589         contarget_get_lattice_mat(ob, substring, mat);
00590         constraint_mat_convertspace(ob, NULL, mat, from, to);
00591     }
00592     /*  Case BONE */
00593     else {
00594         bPoseChannel *pchan;
00595         
00596         pchan = get_pose_channel(ob->pose, substring);
00597         if (pchan) {
00598             /* Multiply the PoseSpace accumulation/final matrix for this
00599              * PoseChannel by the Armature Object's Matrix to get a worldspace
00600              * matrix.
00601              */
00602             if (headtail < 0.000001f) {
00603                 /* skip length interpolation if set to head */
00604                 mult_m4_m4m4(mat, ob->obmat, pchan->pose_mat);
00605             }
00606             else {
00607                 float tempmat[4][4], loc[3];
00608                 
00609                 /* interpolate along length of bone */
00610                 interp_v3_v3v3(loc, pchan->pose_head, pchan->pose_tail, headtail);  
00611                 
00612                 /* use interpolated distance for subtarget */
00613                 copy_m4_m4(tempmat, pchan->pose_mat);   
00614                 copy_v3_v3(tempmat[3], loc);
00615                 
00616                 mult_m4_m4m4(mat, ob->obmat, tempmat);
00617             }
00618         } 
00619         else
00620             copy_m4_m4(mat, ob->obmat);
00621             
00622         /* convert matrix space as required */
00623         constraint_mat_convertspace(ob, pchan, mat, from, to);
00624     }
00625 }
00626 
00627 /* ************************* Specific Constraints ***************************** */
00628 /* Each constraint defines a set of functions, which will be called at the appropriate
00629  * times. In addition to this, each constraint should have a type-info struct, where
00630  * its functions are attached for use. 
00631  */
00632  
00633 /* Template for type-info data:
00634  *  - make a copy of this when creating new constraints, and just change the functions
00635  *    pointed to as necessary
00636  *  - although the naming of functions doesn't matter, it would help for code
00637  *    readability, to follow the same naming convention as is presented here
00638  *  - any functions that a constraint doesn't need to define, don't define
00639  *    for such cases, just use NULL 
00640  *  - these should be defined after all the functions have been defined, so that
00641  *    forward-definitions/prototypes don't need to be used!
00642  *  - keep this copy #if-def'd so that future constraints can get based off this
00643  */
00644 #if 0
00645 static bConstraintTypeInfo CTI_CONSTRNAME = {
00646     CONSTRAINT_TYPE_CONSTRNAME, /* type */
00647     sizeof(bConstrNameConstraint), /* size */
00648     "ConstrName", /* name */
00649     "bConstrNameConstraint", /* struct name */
00650     constrname_free, /* free data */
00651     constrname_relink, /* relink data */
00652     constrname_id_looper, /* id looper */
00653     constrname_copy, /* copy data */
00654     constrname_new_data, /* new data */
00655     constrname_get_tars, /* get constraint targets */
00656     constrname_flush_tars, /* flush constraint targets */
00657     constrname_get_tarmat, /* get target matrix */
00658     constrname_evaluate /* evaluate */
00659 };
00660 #endif
00661 
00662 /* This function should be used for the get_target_matrix member of all 
00663  * constraints that are not picky about what happens to their target matrix.
00664  */
00665 static void default_get_tarmat (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *UNUSED(cob), bConstraintTarget *ct, float UNUSED(ctime))
00666 {
00667     if (VALID_CONS_TARGET(ct))
00668         constraint_target_to_mat4(ct->tar, ct->subtarget, ct->matrix, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_WORLD, ct->space, con->headtail);
00669     else if (ct)
00670         unit_m4(ct->matrix);
00671 }
00672 
00673 /* This following macro should be used for all standard single-target *_get_tars functions 
00674  * to save typing and reduce maintenance woes.
00675  * (Hopefully all compilers will be happy with the lines with just a space on them. Those are
00676  *  really just to help this code easier to read)
00677  */
00678 // TODO: cope with getting rotation order...
00679 #define SINGLETARGET_GET_TARS(con, datatar, datasubtarget, ct, list) \
00680     { \
00681         ct= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bConstraintTarget), "tempConstraintTarget"); \
00682          \
00683         ct->tar= datatar; \
00684         BLI_strncpy(ct->subtarget, datasubtarget, sizeof(ct->subtarget)); \
00685         ct->space= con->tarspace; \
00686         ct->flag= CONSTRAINT_TAR_TEMP; \
00687          \
00688         if (ct->tar) { \
00689             if ((ct->tar->type==OB_ARMATURE) && (ct->subtarget[0])) { \
00690                 bPoseChannel *pchan= get_pose_channel(ct->tar->pose, ct->subtarget); \
00691                 ct->type = CONSTRAINT_OBTYPE_BONE; \
00692                 ct->rotOrder= (pchan) ? (pchan->rotmode) : EULER_ORDER_DEFAULT; \
00693             }\
00694             else if (OB_TYPE_SUPPORT_VGROUP(ct->tar->type) && (ct->subtarget[0])) { \
00695                 ct->type = CONSTRAINT_OBTYPE_VERT; \
00696                 ct->rotOrder = EULER_ORDER_DEFAULT; \
00697             } \
00698             else {\
00699                 ct->type = CONSTRAINT_OBTYPE_OBJECT; \
00700                 ct->rotOrder= ct->tar->rotmode; \
00701             } \
00702         } \
00703          \
00704         BLI_addtail(list, ct); \
00705     }
00706     
00707 /* This following macro should be used for all standard single-target *_get_tars functions 
00708  * to save typing and reduce maintenance woes. It does not do the subtarget related operations
00709  * (Hopefully all compilers will be happy with the lines with just a space on them. Those are
00710  *  really just to help this code easier to read)
00711  */
00712 // TODO: cope with getting rotation order...
00713 #define SINGLETARGETNS_GET_TARS(con, datatar, ct, list) \
00714     { \
00715         ct= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bConstraintTarget), "tempConstraintTarget"); \
00716          \
00717         ct->tar= datatar; \
00718         ct->space= con->tarspace; \
00719         ct->flag= CONSTRAINT_TAR_TEMP; \
00720          \
00721         if (ct->tar) ct->type = CONSTRAINT_OBTYPE_OBJECT; \
00722          \
00723         BLI_addtail(list, ct); \
00724     }
00725 
00726 /* This following macro should be used for all standard single-target *_flush_tars functions
00727  * to save typing and reduce maintenance woes.
00728  * Note: the pointer to ct will be changed to point to the next in the list (as it gets removed)
00729  * (Hopefully all compilers will be happy with the lines with just a space on them. Those are
00730  *  really just to help this code easier to read)
00731  */
00732 #define SINGLETARGET_FLUSH_TARS(con, datatar, datasubtarget, ct, list, nocopy) \
00733     { \
00734         if (ct) { \
00735             bConstraintTarget *ctn = ct->next; \
00736             if (nocopy == 0) { \
00737                 datatar= ct->tar; \
00738                 BLI_strncpy(datasubtarget, ct->subtarget, sizeof(datasubtarget)); \
00739                 con->tarspace= (char)ct->space; \
00740             } \
00741              \
00742             BLI_freelinkN(list, ct); \
00743             ct= ctn; \
00744         } \
00745     }
00746     
00747 /* This following macro should be used for all standard single-target *_flush_tars functions
00748  * to save typing and reduce maintenance woes. It does not do the subtarget related operations.
00749  * Note: the pointer to ct will be changed to point to the next in the list (as it gets removed)
00750  * (Hopefully all compilers will be happy with the lines with just a space on them. Those are
00751  *  really just to help this code easier to read)
00752  */
00753 #define SINGLETARGETNS_FLUSH_TARS(con, datatar, ct, list, nocopy) \
00754     { \
00755         if (ct) { \
00756             bConstraintTarget *ctn = ct->next; \
00757             if (nocopy == 0) { \
00758                 datatar= ct->tar; \
00759                 con->tarspace= (char)ct->space; \
00760             } \
00761              \
00762             BLI_freelinkN(list, ct); \
00763             ct= ctn; \
00764         } \
00765     }
00766  
00767 /* --------- ChildOf Constraint ------------ */
00768 
00769 static void childof_new_data (void *cdata)
00770 {
00771     bChildOfConstraint *data= (bChildOfConstraint *)cdata;
00772     
00773     data->flag = (CHILDOF_LOCX | CHILDOF_LOCY | CHILDOF_LOCZ |
00774                     CHILDOF_ROTX |CHILDOF_ROTY | CHILDOF_ROTZ |
00775                     CHILDOF_SIZEX | CHILDOF_SIZEY | CHILDOF_SIZEZ);
00776     unit_m4(data->invmat);
00777 }
00778 
00779 static void childof_id_looper (bConstraint *con, ConstraintIDFunc func, void *userdata)
00780 {
00781     bChildOfConstraint *data= con->data;
00782     
00783     /* target only */
00784     func(con, (ID**)&data->tar, userdata);
00785 }
00786 
00787 static int childof_get_tars (bConstraint *con, ListBase *list)
00788 {
00789     if (con && list) {
00790         bChildOfConstraint *data= con->data;
00791         bConstraintTarget *ct;
00792         
00793         /* standard target-getting macro for single-target constraints */
00794         SINGLETARGET_GET_TARS(con, data->tar, data->subtarget, ct, list)
00795         
00796         return 1;
00797     }
00798     
00799     return 0;
00800 }
00801 
00802 static void childof_flush_tars (bConstraint *con, ListBase *list, short nocopy)
00803 {
00804     if (con && list) {
00805         bChildOfConstraint *data= con->data;
00806         bConstraintTarget *ct= list->first;
00807         
00808         /* the following macro is used for all standard single-target constraints */
00809         SINGLETARGET_FLUSH_TARS(con, data->tar, data->subtarget, ct, list, nocopy)
00810     }
00811 }
00812 
00813 static void childof_evaluate (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *targets)
00814 {
00815     bChildOfConstraint *data= con->data;
00816     bConstraintTarget *ct= targets->first;
00817 
00818     /* only evaluate if there is a target */
00819     if (VALID_CONS_TARGET(ct)) {
00820         float parmat[4][4];
00821         
00822         /* simple matrix parenting */
00823         if (data->flag == CHILDOF_ALL) {
00824             
00825             /* multiply target (parent matrix) by offset (parent inverse) to get 
00826              * the effect of the parent that will be exherted on the owner
00827              */
00828             mult_m4_m4m4(parmat, ct->matrix, data->invmat);
00829             
00830             /* now multiply the parent matrix by the owner matrix to get the 
00831              * the effect of this constraint (i.e.  owner is 'parented' to parent)
00832              */
00833             mult_m4_m4m4(cob->matrix, parmat, cob->matrix);
00834         }
00835         else {
00836             float invmat[4][4], tempmat[4][4];
00837             float loc[3], eul[3], size[3];
00838             float loco[3], eulo[3], sizo[3];
00839             
00840             /* get offset (parent-inverse) matrix */
00841             copy_m4_m4(invmat, data->invmat);
00842             
00843             /* extract components of both matrices */
00844             copy_v3_v3(loc, ct->matrix[3]);
00845             mat4_to_eulO(eul, ct->rotOrder, ct->matrix);
00846             mat4_to_size(size, ct->matrix);
00847             
00848             copy_v3_v3(loco, invmat[3]);
00849             mat4_to_eulO(eulo, cob->rotOrder, invmat);
00850             mat4_to_size(sizo, invmat);
00851             
00852             /* disable channels not enabled */
00853             if (!(data->flag & CHILDOF_LOCX)) loc[0]= loco[0]= 0.0f;
00854             if (!(data->flag & CHILDOF_LOCY)) loc[1]= loco[1]= 0.0f;
00855             if (!(data->flag & CHILDOF_LOCZ)) loc[2]= loco[2]= 0.0f;
00856             if (!(data->flag & CHILDOF_ROTX)) eul[0]= eulo[0]= 0.0f;
00857             if (!(data->flag & CHILDOF_ROTY)) eul[1]= eulo[1]= 0.0f;
00858             if (!(data->flag & CHILDOF_ROTZ)) eul[2]= eulo[2]= 0.0f;
00859             if (!(data->flag & CHILDOF_SIZEX)) size[0]= sizo[0]= 1.0f;
00860             if (!(data->flag & CHILDOF_SIZEY)) size[1]= sizo[1]= 1.0f;
00861             if (!(data->flag & CHILDOF_SIZEZ)) size[2]= sizo[2]= 1.0f;
00862             
00863             /* make new target mat and offset mat */
00864             loc_eulO_size_to_mat4(ct->matrix, loc, eul, size, ct->rotOrder);
00865             loc_eulO_size_to_mat4(invmat, loco, eulo, sizo, cob->rotOrder);
00866             
00867             /* multiply target (parent matrix) by offset (parent inverse) to get 
00868              * the effect of the parent that will be exherted on the owner
00869              */
00870             mult_m4_m4m4(parmat, ct->matrix, invmat);
00871             
00872             /* now multiply the parent matrix by the owner matrix to get the 
00873              * the effect of this constraint (i.e.  owner is 'parented' to parent)
00874              */
00875             copy_m4_m4(tempmat, cob->matrix);
00876             mult_m4_m4m4(cob->matrix, parmat, tempmat);
00877 
00878             /* without this, changes to scale and rotation can change location
00879              * of a parentless bone or a disconnected bone. Even though its set
00880              * to zero above. */
00881             if (!(data->flag & CHILDOF_LOCX)) cob->matrix[3][0]= tempmat[3][0];
00882             if (!(data->flag & CHILDOF_LOCY)) cob->matrix[3][1]= tempmat[3][1];
00883             if (!(data->flag & CHILDOF_LOCZ)) cob->matrix[3][2]= tempmat[3][2]; 
00884         }
00885     }
00886 }
00887 
00888 /* XXX note, con->flag should be CONSTRAINT_SPACEONCE for bone-childof, patched in readfile.c */
00889 static bConstraintTypeInfo CTI_CHILDOF = {
00890     CONSTRAINT_TYPE_CHILDOF, /* type */
00891     sizeof(bChildOfConstraint), /* size */
00892     "ChildOf", /* name */
00893     "bChildOfConstraint", /* struct name */
00894     NULL, /* free data */
00895     NULL, /* relink data */
00896     childof_id_looper, /* id looper */
00897     NULL, /* copy data */
00898     childof_new_data, /* new data */
00899     childof_get_tars, /* get constraint targets */
00900     childof_flush_tars, /* flush constraint targets */
00901     default_get_tarmat, /* get a target matrix */
00902     childof_evaluate /* evaluate */
00903 };

00949 
00950 static int basis_cross (int n, int m)
00951 {
00952     switch (n-m) {
00953         case 1: 
00954         case -2:
00955             return 1;
00956             
00957         case -1: 
00958         case 2:
00959             return -1;
00960             
00961         default:
00962             return 0;
00963     }
00964 }
00965 
00966 static void vectomat (float *vec, float *target_up, short axis, short upflag, short flags, float m[][3])
00967 {
00968     float n[3];
00969     float u[3]; /* vector specifying the up axis */
00970     float proj[3];
00971     float right[3];
00972     float neg = -1;
00973     int right_index;
00974 
00975     if (normalize_v3_v3(n, vec) == 0.0f) {
00976         n[0] = 0.0f;
00977         n[1] = 0.0f;
00978         n[2] = 1.0f;
00979     }
00980     if (axis > 2) axis -= 3;
00981     else negate_v3(n);
00982 
00983     /* n specifies the transformation of the track axis */
00984     if (flags & TARGET_Z_UP) { 
00985         /* target Z axis is the global up axis */
00986         copy_v3_v3(u, target_up);
00987     }
00988     else { 
00989         /* world Z axis is the global up axis */
00990         u[0] = 0;
00991         u[1] = 0;
00992         u[2] = 1;
00993     }
00994 
00995     /* project the up vector onto the plane specified by n */
00996     project_v3_v3v3(proj, u, n); /* first u onto n... */
00997     sub_v3_v3v3(proj, u, proj); /* then onto the plane */
00998     /* proj specifies the transformation of the up axis */
00999 
01000     if (normalize_v3(proj) == 0.0f) { /* degenerate projection */
01001         proj[0] = 0.0f;
01002         proj[1] = 1.0f;
01003         proj[2] = 0.0f;
01004     }
01005 
01006     /* Normalized cross product of n and proj specifies transformation of the right axis */
01007     cross_v3_v3v3(right, proj, n);
01008     normalize_v3(right);
01009 
01010     if (axis != upflag) {
01011         right_index = 3 - axis - upflag;
01012         neg = (float)basis_cross(axis, upflag);
01013         
01014         /* account for up direction, track direction */
01015         m[right_index][0] = neg * right[0];
01016         m[right_index][1] = neg * right[1];
01017         m[right_index][2] = neg * right[2];
01018         
01019         copy_v3_v3(m[upflag], proj);
01020         
01021         copy_v3_v3(m[axis], n);
01022     }
01023     /* identity matrix - don't do anything if the two axes are the same */
01024     else {
01025         unit_m3(m);
01026     }
01027 }
01028 
01029 
01030 static void trackto_evaluate (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *targets)
01031 {
01032     bTrackToConstraint *data= con->data;
01033     bConstraintTarget *ct= targets->first;
01034     
01035     if (VALID_CONS_TARGET(ct)) {
01036         float size[3], vec[3];
01037         float totmat[3][3];
01038         float tmat[4][4];
01039         
01040         /* Get size property, since ob->size is only the object's own relative size, not its global one */
01041         mat4_to_size(size, cob->matrix);
01042         
01043         /* Clear the object's rotation */   
01044         cob->matrix[0][0]=size[0];
01045         cob->matrix[0][1]=0;
01046         cob->matrix[0][2]=0;
01047         cob->matrix[1][0]=0;
01048         cob->matrix[1][1]=size[1];
01049         cob->matrix[1][2]=0;
01050         cob->matrix[2][0]=0;
01051         cob->matrix[2][1]=0;
01052         cob->matrix[2][2]=size[2];
01053         
01054         /* targetmat[2] instead of ownermat[2] is passed to vectomat
01055          * for backwards compatibility it seems... (Aligorith)
01056          */
01057         sub_v3_v3v3(vec, cob->matrix[3], ct->matrix[3]);
01058         vectomat(vec, ct->matrix[2], 
01059                 (short)data->reserved1, (short)data->reserved2, 
01060                 data->flags, totmat);
01061         
01062         copy_m4_m4(tmat, cob->matrix);
01063         mul_m4_m3m4(cob->matrix, totmat, tmat);
01064     }
01065 }
01066 
01067 static bConstraintTypeInfo CTI_TRACKTO = {
01068     CONSTRAINT_TYPE_TRACKTO, /* type */
01069     sizeof(bTrackToConstraint), /* size */
01070     "TrackTo", /* name */
01071     "bTrackToConstraint", /* struct name */
01072     NULL, /* free data */
01073     NULL, /* relink data */
01074     trackto_id_looper, /* id looper */
01075     NULL, /* copy data */
01076     trackto_new_data, /* new data */
01077     trackto_get_tars, /* get constraint targets */
01078     trackto_flush_tars, /* flush constraint targets */
01079     default_get_tarmat, /* get target matrix */
01080     trackto_evaluate /* evaluate */
01081 };

01083 /* --------- Inverse-Kinemetics --------- */
01084 
01085 static void kinematic_new_data (void *cdata)
01086 {
01087     bKinematicConstraint *data= (bKinematicConstraint *)cdata;
01088     
01089     data->weight= 1.0f;
01090     data->orientweight= 1.0f;
01091     data->iterations = 500;
01092     data->dist= 1.0f;
01093     data->flag= CONSTRAINT_IK_TIP|CONSTRAINT_IK_STRETCH|CONSTRAINT_IK_POS;
01094 }
01095 
01096 static void kinematic_id_looper (bConstraint *con, ConstraintIDFunc func, void *userdata)
01097 {
01098     bKinematicConstraint *data= con->data;
01099     
01100     /* chain target */
01101     func(con, (ID**)&data->tar, userdata);
01102     
01103     /* poletarget */
01104     func(con, (ID**)&data->poletar, userdata);
01105 }
01106 
01107 static int kinematic_get_tars (bConstraint *con, ListBase *list)
01108 {
01109     if (con && list) {
01110         bKinematicConstraint *data= con->data;
01111         bConstraintTarget *ct;
01112         
01113         /* standard target-getting macro for single-target constraints is used twice here */
01114         SINGLETARGET_GET_TARS(con, data->tar, data->subtarget, ct, list)
01115         SINGLETARGET_GET_TARS(con, data->poletar, data->polesubtarget, ct, list)
01116         
01117         return 2;
01118     }
01119     
01120     return 0;
01121 }
01122 
01123 static void kinematic_flush_tars (bConstraint *con, ListBase *list, short nocopy)
01124 {
01125     if (con && list) {
01126         bKinematicConstraint *data= con->data;
01127         bConstraintTarget *ct= list->first;
01128         
01129         /* the following macro is used for all standard single-target constraints */
01130         SINGLETARGET_FLUSH_TARS(con, data->tar, data->subtarget, ct, list, nocopy)
01131         SINGLETARGET_FLUSH_TARS(con, data->poletar, data->polesubtarget, ct, list, nocopy)
01132     }
01133 }
01134 
01135 static void kinematic_get_tarmat (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, bConstraintTarget *ct, float UNUSED(ctime))
01136 {
01137     bKinematicConstraint *data= con->data;
01138     
01139     if (VALID_CONS_TARGET(ct)) 
01140         constraint_target_to_mat4(ct->tar, ct->subtarget, ct->matrix, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_WORLD, ct->space, con->headtail);
01141     else if (ct) {
01142         if (data->flag & CONSTRAINT_IK_AUTO) {
01143             Object *ob= cob->ob;
01144             
01145             if (ob == NULL) {
01146                 unit_m4(ct->matrix);
01147             }
01148             else {
01149                 float vec[3];
01150                 /* move grabtarget into world space */
01151                 mul_v3_m4v3(vec, ob->obmat, data->grabtarget);
01152                 copy_m4_m4(ct->matrix, ob->obmat);
01153                 copy_v3_v3(ct->matrix[3], vec);
01154             }
01155         }
01156         else
01157             unit_m4(ct->matrix);
01158     }
01159 }
01160 
01161 static bConstraintTypeInfo CTI_KINEMATIC = {
01162     CONSTRAINT_TYPE_KINEMATIC, /* type */
01163     sizeof(bKinematicConstraint), /* size */
01164     "IK", /* name */
01165     "bKinematicConstraint", /* struct name */
01166     NULL, /* free data */
01167     NULL, /* relink data */
01168     kinematic_id_looper, /* id looper */
01169     NULL, /* copy data */
01170     kinematic_new_data, /* new data */
01171     kinematic_get_tars, /* get constraint targets */
01172     kinematic_flush_tars, /* flush constraint targets */
01173     kinematic_get_tarmat, /* get target matrix */
01174     NULL /* evaluate - solved as separate loop */
01175 };
01176 
01177 /* -------- Follow-Path Constraint ---------- */
01178 
01179 static void followpath_new_data (void *cdata)
01180 {
01181     bFollowPathConstraint *data= (bFollowPathConstraint *)cdata;
01182     
01183     data->trackflag = TRACK_Y;
01184     data->upflag = UP_Z;
01185     data->offset = 0;
01186     data->followflag = 0;
01187 }
01188

01194     func(con, (ID**)&data->tar, userdata);
01195 }

01197 static int followpath_get_tars (bConstraint *con, ListBase *list)
01198 {
01199     if (con && list) {
01200         bFollowPathConstraint *data= con->data;
01201         bConstraintTarget *ct;
01202         
01203         /* standard target-getting macro for single-target constraints without subtargets */
01204         SINGLETARGETNS_GET_TARS(con, data->tar, ct, list)
01205         
01206         return 1;
01207     }
01208     
01209     return 0;
01210 }
01211 
01212 static void followpath_flush_tars (bConstraint *con, ListBase *list, short nocopy)
01213 {
01214     if (con && list) {
01215         bFollowPathConstraint *data= con->data;
01216         bConstraintTarget *ct= list->first;
01217         
01218         /* the following macro is used for all standard single-target constraints */
01219         SINGLETARGETNS_FLUSH_TARS(con, data->tar, ct, list, nocopy)
01220     }
01221 }
01222 
01223 static void followpath_get_tarmat (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, bConstraintTarget *ct, float UNUSED(ctime))
01224 {
01225     bFollowPathConstraint *data= con->data;
01226     
01227     if (VALID_CONS_TARGET(ct)) {
01228         Curve *cu= ct->tar->data;
01229         float vec[4], dir[3], radius;
01230         float totmat[4][4]= MAT4_UNITY;
01231         float curvetime;
01232 
01233         unit_m4(ct->matrix);
01234 
01235         /* note: when creating constraints that follow path, the curve gets the CU_PATH set now,
01236          *      currently for paths to work it needs to go through the bevlist/displist system (ton) 
01237          */
01238         
01239         /* only happens on reload file, but violates depsgraph still... fix! */
01240         if (cu->path==NULL || cu->path->data==NULL)
01241             makeDispListCurveTypes(cob->scene, ct->tar, 0);
01242         
01243         if (cu->path && cu->path->data) {
01244             float quat[4];
01245             if ((data->followflag & FOLLOWPATH_STATIC) == 0) {
01246                 /* animated position along curve depending on time */
01247                 Nurb *nu = cu->nurb.first;
01248                 curvetime= cu->ctime - data->offset;
01249                 
01250                 /* ctime is now a proper var setting of Curve which gets set by Animato like any other var that's animated,
01251                  * but this will only work if it actually is animated... 
01252                  *
01253                  * we divide the curvetime calculated in the previous step by the length of the path, to get a time
01254                  * factor, which then gets clamped to lie within 0.0 - 1.0 range
01255                  */
01256                 curvetime /= cu->pathlen;
01257 
01258                 if (nu && nu->flagu & CU_NURB_CYCLIC) {
01259                     /* If the curve is cyclic, enable looping around if the time is
01260                      * outside the bounds 0..1 */
01261                     if ((curvetime < 0.0f) || (curvetime > 1.0f)) {
01262                         curvetime -= floorf(curvetime);
01263                     }
01264                 }
01265                 else {
01266                     /* The curve is not cyclic, so clamp to the begin/end points. */
01267                     CLAMP(curvetime, 0.0f, 1.0f);
01268                 }
01269             }
01270             else {
01271                 /* fixed position along curve */
01272                 curvetime= data->offset_fac;
01273             }
01274             
01275             if ( where_on_path(ct->tar, curvetime, vec, dir, (data->followflag & FOLLOWPATH_FOLLOW) ? quat : NULL, &radius, NULL) ) { /* quat_pt is quat or NULL*/
01276                 if (data->followflag & FOLLOWPATH_FOLLOW) {
01277 #if 0
01278                     float x1, q[4];
01279                     vec_to_quat(quat, dir, (short)data->trackflag, (short)data->upflag);
01280                     
01281                     normalize_v3(dir);
01282                     q[0]= (float)cos(0.5*vec[3]);
01283                     x1= (float)sin(0.5*vec[3]);
01284                     q[1]= -x1*dir[0];
01285                     q[2]= -x1*dir[1];
01286                     q[3]= -x1*dir[2];
01287                     mul_qt_qtqt(quat, q, quat);
01288 #else
01289                     quat_apply_track(quat, data->trackflag, data->upflag);
01290 #endif
01291 
01292                     quat_to_mat4(totmat, quat);
01293                 }
01294 
01295                 if (data->followflag & FOLLOWPATH_RADIUS) {
01296                     float tmat[4][4], rmat[4][4];
01297                     scale_m4_fl(tmat, radius);
01298                     mult_m4_m4m4(rmat, tmat, totmat);
01299                     copy_m4_m4(totmat, rmat);
01300                 }
01301                 
01302                 copy_v3_v3(totmat[3], vec);
01303                 
01304                 mul_serie_m4(ct->matrix, ct->tar->obmat, totmat, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
01305             }
01306         }
01307     }
01308     else if (ct)
01309         unit_m4(ct->matrix);
01310 }
01311 
01312 static void followpath_evaluate (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *targets)
01313 {
01314     bConstraintTarget *ct= targets->first;
01315     
01316     /* only evaluate if there is a target */
01317     if (VALID_CONS_TARGET(ct)) {
01318         float obmat[4][4];
01319         float size[3];
01320         bFollowPathConstraint *data= con->data;
01321         
01322         /* get Object transform (loc/rot/size) to determine transformation from path */
01323         // TODO: this used to be local at one point, but is probably more useful as-is
01324         copy_m4_m4(obmat, cob->matrix);
01325         
01326         /* get scaling of object before applying constraint */
01327         mat4_to_size(size, cob->matrix);
01328         
01329         /* apply targetmat - containing location on path, and rotation */
01330         mul_serie_m4(cob->matrix, ct->matrix, obmat, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
01331         
01332         /* un-apply scaling caused by path */
01333         if ((data->followflag & FOLLOWPATH_RADIUS)==0) { /* XXX - assume that scale correction means that radius will have some scale error in it - Campbell */
01334             float obsize[3];
01335             
01336             mat4_to_size( obsize,cob->matrix);
01337             if (obsize[0])
01338                 mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[0], size[0] / obsize[0]);
01339             if (obsize[1])
01340                 mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[1], size[1] / obsize[1]);
01341             if (obsize[2])
01342                 mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[2], size[2] / obsize[2]);
01343         }
01344     }
01345 }
01346 
01347 static bConstraintTypeInfo CTI_FOLLOWPATH = {
01348     CONSTRAINT_TYPE_FOLLOWPATH, /* type */
01349     sizeof(bFollowPathConstraint), /* size */
01350     "Follow Path", /* name */
01351     "bFollowPathConstraint", /* struct name */
01352     NULL, /* free data */
01353     NULL, /* relink data */
01354     followpath_id_looper, /* id looper */
01355     NULL, /* copy data */
01356     followpath_new_data, /* new data */
01357     followpath_get_tars, /* get constraint targets */
01358     followpath_flush_tars, /* flush constraint targets */
01359     followpath_get_tarmat, /* get target matrix */
01360     followpath_evaluate /* evaluate */
01361 };
01362 
01363 /* --------- Limit Location --------- */
01364 
01365 
01366 static void loclimit_evaluate (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *UNUSED(targets))
01367 {
01368     bLocLimitConstraint *data = con->data;
01369     
01370     if (data->flag & LIMIT_XMIN) {
01371         if (cob->matrix[3][0] < data->xmin)
01372             cob->matrix[3][0] = data->xmin;
01373     }
01374     if (data->flag & LIMIT_XMAX) {
01375         if (cob->matrix[3][0] > data->xmax)
01376             cob->matrix[3][0] = data->xmax;
01377     }
01378     if (data->flag & LIMIT_YMIN) {
01379         if (cob->matrix[3][1] < data->ymin)
01380             cob->matrix[3][1] = data->ymin;
01381     }
01382     if (data->flag & LIMIT_YMAX) {
01383         if (cob->matrix[3][1] > data->ymax)
01384             cob->matrix[3][1] = data->ymax;
01385     }
01386     if (data->flag & LIMIT_ZMIN) {
01387         if (cob->matrix[3][2] < data->zmin) 
01388             cob->matrix[3][2] = data->zmin;
01389     }
01390     if (data->flag & LIMIT_ZMAX) {
01391         if (cob->matrix[3][2] > data->zmax)
01392             cob->matrix[3][2] = data->zmax;
01393     }
01394 }
01395 
01396 static bConstraintTypeInfo CTI_LOCLIMIT = {
01397     CONSTRAINT_TYPE_LOCLIMIT, /* type */
01398     sizeof(bLocLimitConstraint), /* size */
01399     "Limit Location", /* name */
01400     "bLocLimitConstraint", /* struct name */
01401     NULL, /* free data */
01402     NULL, /* relink data */
01403     NULL, /* id looper */
01404     NULL, /* copy data */
01405     NULL, /* new data */
01406     NULL, /* get constraint targets */
01407     NULL, /* flush constraint targets */
01408     NULL, /* get target matrix */
01409     loclimit_evaluate /* evaluate */
01410 };
01411 
01412 /* -------- Limit Rotation --------- */
01413 
01414 static void rotlimit_evaluate (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *UNUSED(targets))
01415 {
01416     bRotLimitConstraint *data = con->data;
01417     float loc[3];
01418     float eul[3];
01419     float size[3];
01420     
01421     copy_v3_v3(loc, cob->matrix[3]);
01422     mat4_to_size(size, cob->matrix);
01423 
01424     mat4_to_eulO(eul, cob->rotOrder, cob->matrix);
01425 
01426     /* constraint data uses radians internally */
01427     
01428     /* limiting of euler values... */
01429     if (data->flag & LIMIT_XROT) {
01430         if (eul[0] < data->xmin) 
01431             eul[0] = data->xmin;
01432             
01433         if (eul[0] > data->xmax)
01434             eul[0] = data->xmax;
01435     }
01436     if (data->flag & LIMIT_YROT) {
01437         if (eul[1] < data->ymin)
01438             eul[1] = data->ymin;
01439             
01440         if (eul[1] > data->ymax)
01441             eul[1] = data->ymax;
01442     }
01443     if (data->flag & LIMIT_ZROT) {
01444         if (eul[2] < data->zmin)
01445             eul[2] = data->zmin;
01446             
01447         if (eul[2] > data->zmax)
01448             eul[2] = data->zmax;
01449     }
01450         
01451     loc_eulO_size_to_mat4(cob->matrix, loc, eul, size, cob->rotOrder);
01452 }
01453 
01454 static bConstraintTypeInfo CTI_ROTLIMIT = {
01455     CONSTRAINT_TYPE_ROTLIMIT, /* type */
01456     sizeof(bRotLimitConstraint), /* size */
01457     "Limit Rotation", /* name */
01458     "bRotLimitConstraint", /* struct name */
01459     NULL, /* free data */
01460     NULL, /* relink data */
01461     NULL, /* id looper */
01462     NULL, /* copy data */
01463     NULL, /* new data */
01464     NULL, /* get constraint targets */
01465     NULL, /* flush constraint targets */
01466     NULL, /* get target matrix */
01467     rotlimit_evaluate /* evaluate */
01468 };
01469 
01470 /* --------- Limit Scaling --------- */
01471 
01472 
01473 static void sizelimit_evaluate (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *UNUSED(targets))
01474 {
01475     bSizeLimitConstraint *data = con->data;
01476     float obsize[3], size[3];
01477     
01478     mat4_to_size( size,cob->matrix);
01479     mat4_to_size( obsize,cob->matrix);
01480     
01481     if (data->flag & LIMIT_XMIN) {
01482         if (size[0] < data->xmin) 
01483             size[0] = data->xmin;   
01484     }
01485     if (data->flag & LIMIT_XMAX) {
01486         if (size[0] > data->xmax) 
01487             size[0] = data->xmax;
01488     }
01489     if (data->flag & LIMIT_YMIN) {
01490         if (size[1] < data->ymin) 
01491             size[1] = data->ymin;   
01492     }
01493     if (data->flag & LIMIT_YMAX) {
01494         if (size[1] > data->ymax) 
01495             size[1] = data->ymax;
01496     }
01497     if (data->flag & LIMIT_ZMIN) {
01498         if (size[2] < data->zmin) 
01499             size[2] = data->zmin;   
01500     }
01501     if (data->flag & LIMIT_ZMAX) {
01502         if (size[2] > data->zmax) 
01503             size[2] = data->zmax;
01504     }
01505     
01506     if (obsize[0]) 
01507         mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[0], size[0]/obsize[0]);
01508     if (obsize[1]) 
01509         mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[1], size[1]/obsize[1]);
01510     if (obsize[2]) 
01511         mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[2], size[2]/obsize[2]);
01512 }
01513 
01514 static bConstraintTypeInfo CTI_SIZELIMIT = {
01515     CONSTRAINT_TYPE_SIZELIMIT, /* type */
01516     sizeof(bSizeLimitConstraint), /* size */
01517     "Limit Scaling", /* name */
01518     "bSizeLimitConstraint", /* struct name */
01519     NULL, /* free data */
01520     NULL, /* relink data */
01521     NULL, /* id looper */
01522     NULL, /* copy data */
01523     NULL, /* new data */
01524     NULL, /* get constraint targets */
01525     NULL, /* flush constraint targets */
01526     NULL, /* get target matrix */
01527     sizelimit_evaluate /* evaluate */
01528 };

01555

01563 {
01564     if (con && list) {
01565         bLocateLikeConstraint *data= con->data;
01566         bConstraintTarget *ct= list->first;
01567

01570     }

01572 
01573 static void loclike_evaluate (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *targets)
01574 {
01575     bLocateLikeConstraint *data= con->data;
01576     bConstraintTarget *ct= targets->first;
01577     
01578     if (VALID_CONS_TARGET(ct)) {
01579         float offset[3] = {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f};
01580         
01581         if (data->flag & LOCLIKE_OFFSET)
01582             copy_v3_v3(offset, cob->matrix[3]);
01583             
01584         if (data->flag & LOCLIKE_X) {
01585             cob->matrix[3][0] = ct->matrix[3][0];
01586             
01587             if (data->flag & LOCLIKE_X_INVERT) cob->matrix[3][0] *= -1;
01588             cob->matrix[3][0] += offset[0];
01589         }
01590         if (data->flag & LOCLIKE_Y) {
01591             cob->matrix[3][1] = ct->matrix[3][1];
01592             
01593             if (data->flag & LOCLIKE_Y_INVERT) cob->matrix[3][1] *= -1;
01594             cob->matrix[3][1] += offset[1];
01595         }
01596         if (data->flag & LOCLIKE_Z) {
01597             cob->matrix[3][2] = ct->matrix[3][2];
01598             
01599             if (data->flag & LOCLIKE_Z_INVERT) cob->matrix[3][2] *= -1;
01600             cob->matrix[3][2] += offset[2];
01601         }
01602     }
01603 }
01604

01646

01653 static void rotlike_flush_tars (bConstraint *con, ListBase *list, short nocopy)
01654 {
01655     if (con && list) {
01656         bRotateLikeConstraint *data= con->data;
01657         bConstraintTarget *ct= list->first;
01658

01660         SINGLETARGET_FLUSH_TARS(con, data->tar, data->subtarget, ct, list, nocopy)
01661     }
01662 }
01663 
01664 static void rotlike_evaluate (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *targets)
01665 {
01666     bRotateLikeConstraint *data= con->data;
01667     bConstraintTarget *ct= targets->first;
01668     
01669     if (VALID_CONS_TARGET(ct)) {
01670         float   loc[3];
01671         float   eul[3], obeul[3];
01672         float   size[3];
01673         
01674         copy_v3_v3(loc, cob->matrix[3]);
01675         mat4_to_size(size, cob->matrix);
01676         
01677         /* to allow compatible rotations, must get both rotations in the order of the owner... */
01678         mat4_to_eulO(obeul, cob->rotOrder, cob->matrix);
01679         /* we must get compatible eulers from the beginning because some of them can be modified below (see bug #21875) */
01680         mat4_to_compatible_eulO(eul, obeul, cob->rotOrder, ct->matrix);
01681         
01682         if ((data->flag & ROTLIKE_X)==0)
01683             eul[0] = obeul[0];
01684         else {
01685             if (data->flag & ROTLIKE_OFFSET)
01686                 rotate_eulO(eul, cob->rotOrder, 'X', obeul[0]);
01687             
01688             if (data->flag & ROTLIKE_X_INVERT)
01689                 eul[0] *= -1;
01690         }
01691         
01692         if ((data->flag & ROTLIKE_Y)==0)
01693             eul[1] = obeul[1];
01694         else {
01695             if (data->flag & ROTLIKE_OFFSET)
01696                 rotate_eulO(eul, cob->rotOrder, 'Y', obeul[1]);
01697             
01698             if (data->flag & ROTLIKE_Y_INVERT)
01699                 eul[1] *= -1;
01700         }
01701         
01702         if ((data->flag & ROTLIKE_Z)==0)
01703             eul[2] = obeul[2];
01704         else {
01705             if (data->flag & ROTLIKE_OFFSET)
01706                 rotate_eulO(eul, cob->rotOrder, 'Z', obeul[2]);
01707             
01708             if (data->flag & ROTLIKE_Z_INVERT)
01709                 eul[2] *= -1;
01710         }
01711         
01712         /* good to make eulers compatible again, since we don't know how much they were changed above */
01713         compatible_eul(eul, obeul);
01714         loc_eulO_size_to_mat4(cob->matrix, loc, eul, size, cob->rotOrder);
01715     }
01716 }
01717

01721     "Copy Rotation", /* name */
01722     "bRotateLikeConstraint", /* struct name */
01723     NULL, /* free data */
01724     NULL, /* relink data */
01725     rotlike_id_looper, /* id looper */
01726     NULL, /* copy data */

01728     rotlike_get_tars, /* get constraint targets */
01729     rotlike_flush_tars, /* flush constraint targets */
01730     default_get_tarmat, /* get target matrix */
01731     rotlike_evaluate /* evaluate */
01732 };

01765 
01766 static void sizelike_flush_tars (bConstraint *con, ListBase *list, short nocopy)
01767 {
01768     if (con && list) {
01769         bSizeLikeConstraint *data= con->data;
01770         bConstraintTarget *ct= list->first;
01771         
01772         /* the following macro is used for all standard single-target constraints */
01773         SINGLETARGET_FLUSH_TARS(con, data->tar, data->subtarget, ct, list, nocopy)
01774     }
01775 }
01776 
01777 static void sizelike_evaluate (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *targets)
01778 {
01779     bSizeLikeConstraint *data= con->data;
01780     bConstraintTarget *ct= targets->first;
01781     
01782     if (VALID_CONS_TARGET(ct)) {
01783         float obsize[3], size[3];
01784         
01785         mat4_to_size(size, ct->matrix);
01786         mat4_to_size(obsize, cob->matrix);
01787         
01788         if ((data->flag & SIZELIKE_X) && (obsize[0] != 0)) {
01789             if (data->flag & SIZELIKE_OFFSET) {
01790                 size[0] += (obsize[0] - 1.0f);
01791                 mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[0], size[0] / obsize[0]);
01792             }
01793             else
01794                 mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[0], size[0] / obsize[0]);
01795         }
01796         if ((data->flag & SIZELIKE_Y) && (obsize[1] != 0)) {
01797             if (data->flag & SIZELIKE_OFFSET) {
01798                 size[1] += (obsize[1] - 1.0f);
01799                 mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[1], size[1] / obsize[1]);
01800             }
01801             else
01802                 mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[1], size[1] / obsize[1]);
01803         }
01804         if ((data->flag & SIZELIKE_Z) && (obsize[2] != 0)) {
01805             if (data->flag & SIZELIKE_OFFSET) {
01806                 size[2] += (obsize[2] - 1.0f);
01807                 mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[2], size[2] / obsize[2]);
01808             }
01809             else
01810                 mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[2], size[2] / obsize[2]);
01811         }
01812     }
01813 }
01814 
01815 static bConstraintTypeInfo CTI_SIZELIKE = {
01816     CONSTRAINT_TYPE_SIZELIKE, /* type */
01817     sizeof(bSizeLikeConstraint), /* size */
01818     "Copy Scale", /* name */
01819     "bSizeLikeConstraint", /* struct name */
01820     NULL, /* free data */
01821     NULL, /* relink data */
01822     sizelike_id_looper, /* id looper */
01823     NULL, /* copy data */
01824     sizelike_new_data, /* new data */
01825     sizelike_get_tars, /* get constraint targets */
01826     sizelike_flush_tars, /* flush constraint targets */
01827     default_get_tarmat, /* get target matrix */
01828     sizelike_evaluate /* evaluate */
01829 };

01836

01839 }

01842 {
01843     if (con && list) {
01844         bTransLikeConstraint *data= con->data;
01845         bConstraintTarget *ct;
01846         
01847         /* standard target-getting macro for single-target constraints */
01848         SINGLETARGET_GET_TARS(con, data->tar, data->subtarget, ct, list)
01849         
01850         return 1;
01851     }
01852     
01853     return 0;
01854 }

01857 {
01858     if (con && list) {
01859         bTransLikeConstraint *data= con->data;
01860         bConstraintTarget *ct= list->first;
01861         
01862         /* the following macro is used for all standard single-target constraints */

01864     }
01865 }
01866 
01867 static void translike_evaluate (bConstraint *UNUSED(con), bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *targets)
01868 {
01869     bConstraintTarget *ct= targets->first;
01870     
01871     if (VALID_CONS_TARGET(ct)) {
01872         /* just copy the entire transform matrix of the target */
01873         copy_m4_m4(cob->matrix, ct->matrix);
01874     }
01875 }

01892 
01893 /* ---------- Maintain Volume ---------- */
01894 
01895 static void samevolume_new_data (void *cdata)
01896 {
01897     bSameVolumeConstraint *data= (bSameVolumeConstraint *)cdata;
01898 
01899     data->flag = SAMEVOL_Y;
01900     data->volume = 1.0f;
01901 }
01902 
01903 static void samevolume_evaluate (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *UNUSED(targets))
01904 {
01905     bSameVolumeConstraint *data= con->data;
01906 
01907     float volume = data->volume;
01908     float fac = 1.0f;
01909     float obsize[3];
01910 
01911     mat4_to_size(obsize, cob->matrix);
01912     
01913     /* calculate normalizing scale factor for non-essential values */
01914     if (obsize[data->flag] != 0) 
01915         fac = sqrtf(volume / obsize[data->flag]) / obsize[data->flag];
01916     
01917     /* apply scaling factor to the channels not being kept */
01918     switch (data->flag) {
01919         case SAMEVOL_X:
01920             mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[1], fac);
01921             mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[2], fac);
01922             break;
01923         case SAMEVOL_Y:
01924             mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[0], fac);
01925             mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[2], fac);
01926             break;
01927         case SAMEVOL_Z:
01928             mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[0], fac);
01929             mul_v3_fl(cob->matrix[1], fac);
01930             break;
01931     }
01932 }
01933 
01934 static bConstraintTypeInfo CTI_SAMEVOL = {
01935     CONSTRAINT_TYPE_SAMEVOL, /* type */
01936     sizeof(bSameVolumeConstraint), /* size */
01937     "Maintain Volume", /* name */
01938     "bSameVolumeConstraint", /* struct name */
01939     NULL, /* free data */
01940     NULL, /* relink data */
01941     NULL, /* id looper */
01942     NULL, /* copy data */
01943     samevolume_new_data, /* new data */
01944     NULL, /* get constraint targets */
01945     NULL, /* flush constraint targets */
01946     NULL, /* get target matrix */
01947     samevolume_evaluate /* evaluate */
01948 };
01949 
01950 /* ----------- Python Constraint -------------- */
01951 
01952 static void pycon_free (bConstraint *con)
01953 {
01954     bPythonConstraint *data= con->data;
01955     
01956     /* id-properties */
01957     IDP_FreeProperty(data->prop);
01958     MEM_freeN(data->prop);
01959     
01960     /* multiple targets */
01961     BLI_freelistN(&data->targets);
01962 }   
01963 
01964 static void pycon_relink (bConstraint *con)
01965 {
01966     bPythonConstraint *data= con->data;
01967     
01968     ID_NEW(data->text);
01969 }
01970 
01971 static void pycon_copy (bConstraint *con, bConstraint *srccon)
01972 {
01973     bPythonConstraint *pycon = (bPythonConstraint *)con->data;
01974     bPythonConstraint *opycon = (bPythonConstraint *)srccon->data;
01975     
01976     pycon->prop = IDP_CopyProperty(opycon->prop);
01977     BLI_duplicatelist(&pycon->targets, &opycon->targets);
01978 }
01979 
01980 static void pycon_new_data (void *cdata)
01981 {
01982     bPythonConstraint *data= (bPythonConstraint *)cdata;
01983     
01984     /* everything should be set correctly by calloc, except for the prop->type constant.*/
01985     data->prop = MEM_callocN(sizeof(IDProperty), "PyConstraintProps");
01986     data->prop->type = IDP_GROUP;
01987 }
01988 
01989 static int pycon_get_tars (bConstraint *con, ListBase *list)
01990 {
01991     if (con && list) {
01992         bPythonConstraint *data= con->data;
01993         
01994         list->first = data->targets.first;
01995         list->last = data->targets.last;
01996         
01997         return data->tarnum;
01998     }
01999     
02000     return 0;
02001 }
02002 
02003 static void pycon_id_looper (bConstraint *con, ConstraintIDFunc func, void *userdata)
02004 {
02005     bPythonConstraint *data= con->data;
02006     bConstraintTarget *ct;
02007     
02008     /* targets */
02009     for (ct= data->targets.first; ct; ct= ct->next)
02010         func(con, (ID**)&ct->tar, userdata);
02011         
02012     /* script */
02013     func(con, (ID**)&data->text, userdata);
02014 }
02015 
02016 /* Whether this approach is maintained remains to be seen (aligorith) */
02017 static void pycon_get_tarmat (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, bConstraintTarget *ct, float UNUSED(ctime))
02018 {
02019 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON
02020     bPythonConstraint *data= con->data;
02021 #endif
02022 
02023     if (VALID_CONS_TARGET(ct)) {
02024         /* special exception for curves - depsgraph issues */
02025         if (ct->tar->type == OB_CURVE) {
02026             Curve *cu= ct->tar->data;
02027             
02028             /* this check is to make sure curve objects get updated on file load correctly.*/
02029             if (cu->path==NULL || cu->path->data==NULL) /* only happens on reload file, but violates depsgraph still... fix! */
02030                 makeDispListCurveTypes(cob->scene, ct->tar, 0);             
02031         }
02032         
02033         /* firstly calculate the matrix the normal way, then let the py-function override
02034          * this matrix if it needs to do so
02035          */
02036         constraint_target_to_mat4(ct->tar, ct->subtarget, ct->matrix, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_WORLD, ct->space, con->headtail);
02037         
02038         /* only execute target calculation if allowed */
02039 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON
02040         if (G.f & G_SCRIPT_AUTOEXEC)
02041             BPY_pyconstraint_target(data, ct);
02042 #endif
02043     }
02044     else if (ct)
02045         unit_m4(ct->matrix);
02046 }
02047 
02048 static void pycon_evaluate (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *targets)
02049 {
02050 #ifndef WITH_PYTHON
02051     (void)con; (void)cob; (void)targets; /* unused */
02052     return;
02053 #else
02054     bPythonConstraint *data= con->data;
02055     
02056     /* only evaluate in python if we're allowed to do so */
02057     if ((G.f & G_SCRIPT_AUTOEXEC)==0)  return;
02058     
02059 /* currently removed, until I this can be re-implemented for multiple targets */
02060 #if 0
02061     /* Firstly, run the 'driver' function which has direct access to the objects involved 
02062      * Technically, this is potentially dangerous as users may abuse this and cause dependency-problems,
02063      * but it also allows certain 'clever' rigging hacks to work.
02064      */
02065     BPY_pyconstraint_driver(data, cob, targets);
02066 #endif
02067     
02068     /* Now, run the actual 'constraint' function, which should only access the matrices */
02069     BPY_pyconstraint_exec(data, cob, targets);
02070 #endif /* WITH_PYTHON */
02071 }
02072 
02073 static bConstraintTypeInfo CTI_PYTHON = {
02074     CONSTRAINT_TYPE_PYTHON, /* type */
02075     sizeof(bPythonConstraint), /* size */
02076     "Script", /* name */
02077     "bPythonConstraint", /* struct name */
02078     pycon_free, /* free data */
02079     pycon_relink, /* relink data */
02080     pycon_id_looper, /* id looper */
02081     pycon_copy, /* copy data */
02082     pycon_new_data, /* new data */
02083     pycon_get_tars, /* get constraint targets */
02084     NULL, /* flush constraint targets */
02085     pycon_get_tarmat, /* get target matrix */
02086     pycon_evaluate /* evaluate */
02087 };
02088 
02089 /* -------- Action Constraint ----------- */
