04184 }
04185 
04186 static void objectsolver_evaluate(bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *UNUSED(targets))
04187 {
04188     Scene *scene = cob->scene;
04189     bObjectSolverConstraint *data = con->data;
04190     MovieClip *clip = data->clip;
04191     Object *camob = data->camera ? data->camera : scene->camera;
04192 
04193     if (data->flag & OBJECTSOLVER_ACTIVECLIP)
04194         clip= scene->clip;
04195 
04196     if (!camob || !clip)
04197         return;
04198 
04199     if (clip) {
04200         MovieTracking *tracking = &clip->tracking;
04201         MovieTrackingObject *object;
04202 
04203         object = BKE_tracking_named_object(tracking, data->object);
04204 
04205         if (object) {
04206             float mat[4][4], obmat[4][4], imat[4][4], cammat[4][4], camimat[4][4], parmat[4][4];
04207 
04208             where_is_object_mat(scene, camob, cammat);
04209 
04210             BKE_tracking_get_interpolated_camera(tracking, object, scene->r.cfra, mat);
04211 
04212             invert_m4_m4(camimat, cammat);
04213             mult_m4_m4m4(parmat, cammat, data->invmat);
04214 
04215             copy_m4_m4(cammat, camob->obmat);
04216             copy_m4_m4(obmat, cob->matrix);
04217 
04218             invert_m4_m4(imat, mat);
04219 
04220             mul_serie_m4(cob->matrix, cammat, imat, camimat, parmat, obmat, NULL, NULL, NULL);
04221         }
04222     }
04223 }
04224 
04225 static bConstraintTypeInfo CTI_OBJECTSOLVER = {
04226     CONSTRAINT_TYPE_OBJECTSOLVER, /* type */
04227     sizeof(bObjectSolverConstraint), /* size */
04228     "Object Solver", /* name */
04229     "bObjectSolverConstraint", /* struct name */
04230     NULL, /* free data */
04231     NULL, /* relink data */
04232     objectsolver_id_looper, /* id looper */
04233     NULL, /* copy data */
04234     objectsolver_new_data, /* new data */
04235     NULL, /* get constraint targets */
04236     NULL, /* flush constraint targets */
04237     NULL, /* get target matrix */
04238     objectsolver_evaluate /* evaluate */
04239 };
04240 
04241 /* ************************* Constraints Type-Info *************************** */
04242 /* All of the constraints api functions use bConstraintTypeInfo structs to carry out
04243  * and operations that involve constraint specific code.
04244  */
04245 
04246 /* These globals only ever get directly accessed in this file */
04247 static bConstraintTypeInfo *constraintsTypeInfo[NUM_CONSTRAINT_TYPES];
04248 static short CTI_INIT= 1; /* when non-zero, the list needs to be updated */
04249 
04250 /* This function only gets called when CTI_INIT is non-zero */
04251 static void constraints_init_typeinfo (void)
04252 {
04253     constraintsTypeInfo[0]=  NULL;                  /* 'Null' Constraint */
04254     constraintsTypeInfo[1]=  &CTI_CHILDOF;          /* ChildOf Constraint */
04255     constraintsTypeInfo[2]=  &CTI_TRACKTO;          /* TrackTo Constraint */
04256     constraintsTypeInfo[3]=  &CTI_KINEMATIC;        /* IK Constraint */
04257     constraintsTypeInfo[4]=  &CTI_FOLLOWPATH;       /* Follow-Path Constraint */
04258     constraintsTypeInfo[5]=  &CTI_ROTLIMIT;         /* Limit Rotation Constraint */
04259     constraintsTypeInfo[6]=  &CTI_LOCLIMIT;         /* Limit Location Constraint */
04260     constraintsTypeInfo[7]=  &CTI_SIZELIMIT;        /* Limit Scaling Constraint */
04261     constraintsTypeInfo[8]=  &CTI_ROTLIKE;          /* Copy Rotation Constraint */
04262     constraintsTypeInfo[9]=  &CTI_LOCLIKE;          /* Copy Location Constraint */
04263     constraintsTypeInfo[10]= &CTI_SIZELIKE;         /* Copy Scaling Constraint */
04264     constraintsTypeInfo[11]= &CTI_PYTHON;           /* Python/Script Constraint */
04265     constraintsTypeInfo[12]= &CTI_ACTION;           /* Action Constraint */
04266     constraintsTypeInfo[13]= &CTI_LOCKTRACK;        /* Locked-Track Constraint */
04267     constraintsTypeInfo[14]= &CTI_DISTLIMIT;        /* Limit Distance Constraint */
04268     constraintsTypeInfo[15]= &CTI_STRETCHTO;        /* StretchTo Constaint */ 
04269     constraintsTypeInfo[16]= &CTI_MINMAX;           /* Floor Constraint */
04270     constraintsTypeInfo[17]= &CTI_RIGIDBODYJOINT;   /* RigidBody Constraint */
04271     constraintsTypeInfo[18]= &CTI_CLAMPTO;          /* ClampTo Constraint */    
04272     constraintsTypeInfo[19]= &CTI_TRANSFORM;        /* Transformation Constraint */
04273     constraintsTypeInfo[20]= &CTI_SHRINKWRAP;       /* Shrinkwrap Constraint */
04274     constraintsTypeInfo[21]= &CTI_DAMPTRACK;        /* Damped TrackTo Constraint */
04275     constraintsTypeInfo[22]= &CTI_SPLINEIK;         /* Spline IK Constraint */
04276     constraintsTypeInfo[23]= &CTI_TRANSLIKE;        /* Copy Transforms Constraint */
04277     constraintsTypeInfo[24]= &CTI_SAMEVOL;          /* Maintain Volume Constraint */
04278     constraintsTypeInfo[25]= &CTI_PIVOT;            /* Pivot Constraint */
04279     constraintsTypeInfo[26]= &CTI_FOLLOWTRACK;      /* Follow Track Constraint */
04280     constraintsTypeInfo[27]= &CTI_CAMERASOLVER;     /* Camera Solver Constraint */
04281     constraintsTypeInfo[28]= &CTI_OBJECTSOLVER;     /* Object Solver Constraint */
04282 }
04283 
04284 /* This function should be used for getting the appropriate type-info when only
04285  * a constraint type is known
04286  */
04287 bConstraintTypeInfo *get_constraint_typeinfo (int type)
04288 {
04289     /* initialize the type-info list? */
04290     if (CTI_INIT) {
04291         constraints_init_typeinfo();
04292         CTI_INIT = 0;
04293     }
04294     
04295     /* only return for valid types */
04296     if ( (type >= CONSTRAINT_TYPE_NULL) && 
04297          (type < NUM_CONSTRAINT_TYPES ) ) 
04298     {
04299         /* there shouldn't be any segfaults here... */
04300         return constraintsTypeInfo[type];
04301     }
04302     else {
04303         printf("No valid constraint type-info data available. Type = %i\n", type);
04304     }
04305     
04306     return NULL;
04307 } 
04308  
04309 /* This function should always be used to get the appropriate type-info, as it
04310  * has checks which prevent segfaults in some weird cases.
04311  */
04312 bConstraintTypeInfo *constraint_get_typeinfo (bConstraint *con)
04313 {
04314     /* only return typeinfo for valid constraints */
04315     if (con)
04316         return get_constraint_typeinfo(con->type);
04317     else
04318         return NULL;
04319 }
04320 
04321 /* ************************* General Constraints API ************************** */
04322 /* The functions here are called by various parts of Blender. Very few (should be none if possible)
04323  * constraint-specific code should occur here.
04324  */
04325  
04326 /* ---------- Data Management ------- */
04327 
04328 /* Free data of a specific constraint if it has any info.
04329  * be sure to run BIK_clear_data() when freeing an IK constraint,
04330  * unless DAG_scene_sort is called. */
04331 void free_constraint_data (bConstraint *con)
04332 {
04333     if (con->data) {
04334         bConstraintTypeInfo *cti= constraint_get_typeinfo(con);
04335         
04336         /* perform any special freeing constraint may have */
04337         if (cti && cti->free_data)
04338             cti->free_data(con);
04339         
04340         /* free constraint data now */
04341         MEM_freeN(con->data);
04342     }
04343 }
04344 
04345 /* Free all constraints from a constraint-stack */
04346 void free_constraints (ListBase *list)
04347 {
04348     bConstraint *con;
04349     
04350     /* Free constraint data and also any extra data */
04351     for (con= list->first; con; con= con->next)
04352         free_constraint_data(con);
04353     
04354     /* Free the whole list */
04355     BLI_freelistN(list);
04356 }
04357 
04358 
04359 /* Remove the specified constraint from the given constraint stack */
04360 int remove_constraint (ListBase *list, bConstraint *con)
04361 {
04362     if (con) {
04363         free_constraint_data(con);
04364         BLI_freelinkN(list, con);
04365         return 1;
04366     }
04367     else
04368         return 0;
04369 }
04370 
04371 /* Remove all the constraints of the specified type from the given constraint stack */
04372 void remove_constraints_type (ListBase *list, short type, short last_only)
04373 {
04374     bConstraint *con, *conp;
04375     
04376     if (list == NULL)
04377         return;
04378     
04379     /* remove from the end of the list to make it faster to find the last instance */
04380     for (con= list->last; con; con= conp) {
04381         conp= con->prev;
04382         
04383         if (con->type == type) {
04384             remove_constraint(list, con);
04385             if (last_only) 
04386                 return;
04387         }
04388     }
04389 }
04390 
04391 /* ......... */
04392 
04393 /* Creates a new constraint, initializes its data, and returns it */
04394 static bConstraint *add_new_constraint_internal (const char *name, short type)
04395 {
04396     bConstraint *con= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bConstraint), "Constraint");
04397     bConstraintTypeInfo *cti= get_constraint_typeinfo(type);
04398     const char *newName;
04399 
04400     /* Set up a generic constraint datablock */
04401     con->type = type;
04402     con->flag |= CONSTRAINT_EXPAND;
04403     con->enforce = 1.0f;
04404 
04405     /* Determine a basic name, and info */
04406     if (cti) {
04407         /* initialize constraint data */
04408         con->data = MEM_callocN(cti->size, cti->structName);
04409         
04410         /* only constraints that change any settings need this */
04411         if (cti->new_data)
04412             cti->new_data(con->data);
04413         
04414         /* if no name is provided, use the type of the constraint as the name */
04415         newName= (name && name[0]) ? name : cti->name;
04416     }
04417     else {
04418         /* if no name is provided, use the generic "Const" name */
04419         // NOTE: any constraint type that gets here really shouldn't get added...
04420         newName= (name && name[0]) ? name : "Const";
04421     }
04422     
04423     /* copy the name */
04424     BLI_strncpy(con->name, newName, sizeof(con->name));
04425     
04426     /* return the new constraint */
04427     return con;
04428 }
04429 
04430 /* if pchan is not NULL then assume we're adding a pose constraint */
04431 static bConstraint *add_new_constraint (Object *ob, bPoseChannel *pchan, const char *name, short type)
04432 {
04433     bConstraint *con;
04434     ListBase *list;
04435     
04436     /* add the constraint */
04437     con= add_new_constraint_internal(name, type);
04438     
04439     /* find the constraint stack - bone or object? */
04440     list = (pchan) ? (&pchan->constraints) : (&ob->constraints);
04441     
04442     if (list) {
04443         /* add new constraint to end of list of constraints before ensuring that it has a unique name
04444          * (otherwise unique-naming code will fail, since it assumes element exists in list)
04445          */
04446         BLI_addtail(list, con);
04447         unique_constraint_name(con, list);
04448         
04449         /* if the target list is a list on some PoseChannel belonging to a proxy-protected
04450          * Armature layer, we must tag newly added constraints with a flag which allows them
04451          * to persist after proxy syncing has been done
04452          */
04453         if (proxylocked_constraints_owner(ob, pchan))
04454             con->flag |= CONSTRAINT_PROXY_LOCAL;
04455         
04456         /* make this constraint the active one */
04457         constraints_set_active(list, con);
04458     }
04459     
04460     /* set type+owner specific immutable settings */
04461     // TODO: does action constraint need anything here - i.e. spaceonce?
04462     switch (type) {
04463         case CONSTRAINT_TYPE_CHILDOF:
04464         {
04465             /* if this constraint is being added to a posechannel, make sure
04466              * the constraint gets evaluated in pose-space */
04467             if (pchan) {
04468                 con->ownspace = CONSTRAINT_SPACE_POSE;
04469                 con->flag |= CONSTRAINT_SPACEONCE;
04470             }
04471         }
04472             break;
04473     }
04474     
04475     return con;
04476 }
04477 
04478 /* ......... */
04479 
04480 /* Add new constraint for the given bone */
04481 bConstraint *add_pose_constraint (Object *ob, bPoseChannel *pchan, const char *name, short type)
04482 {
04483     if (pchan == NULL)
04484         return NULL;
04485     
04486     return add_new_constraint(ob, pchan, name, type);
04487 }
04488 
04489 /* Add new constraint for the given object */
04490 bConstraint *add_ob_constraint(Object *ob, const char *name, short type)
04491 {
04492     return add_new_constraint(ob, NULL, name, type);
04493 }
04494 
04495 /* ......... */
04496 
04497 /* Reassign links that constraints have to other data (called during file loading?) */
04498 void relink_constraints (ListBase *conlist)
04499 {
04500     bConstraint *con;
04501     bConstraintTarget *ct;
04502     
04503     for (con= conlist->first; con; con= con->next) {
04504         bConstraintTypeInfo *cti= constraint_get_typeinfo(con);
04505         
04506         if (cti) {
04507             /* relink any targets */
04508             if (cti->get_constraint_targets) {
04509                 ListBase targets = {NULL, NULL};
04510                 
04511                 cti->get_constraint_targets(con, &targets);
04512                 for (ct= targets.first; ct; ct= ct->next) {
04513                     ID_NEW(ct->tar);
04514                 }
04515                 
04516                 if (cti->flush_constraint_targets)
04517                     cti->flush_constraint_targets(con, &targets, 0);
04518             }
04519             
04520             /* relink any other special data */
04521             if (cti->relink_data)
04522                 cti->relink_data(con);
04523         }
04524     }
04525 }
04526 
04527 /* Run the given callback on all ID-blocks in list of constraints */
04528 void id_loop_constraints (ListBase *conlist, ConstraintIDFunc func, void *userdata)
04529 {
04530     bConstraint *con;
04531     
04532     for (con= conlist->first; con; con= con->next) {
04533         bConstraintTypeInfo *cti= constraint_get_typeinfo(con);
04534         
04535         if (cti) {
04536             if (cti->id_looper)
04537                 cti->id_looper(con, func, userdata);
04538         }
04539     }
04540 }
04541 
04542 /* ......... */
04543 
04544 /* helper for copy_constraints(), to be used for making sure that ID's are valid */
04545 static void con_extern_cb(bConstraint *UNUSED(con), ID **idpoin, void *UNUSED(userData))
04546 {
04547     if (*idpoin && (*idpoin)->lib)
04548         id_lib_extern(*idpoin);
04549 }
04550 
04551 /* duplicate all of the constraints in a constraint stack */
04552 void copy_constraints (ListBase *dst, const ListBase *src, int do_extern)
04553 {
04554     bConstraint *con, *srccon;
04555     
04556     dst->first= dst->last= NULL;
04557     BLI_duplicatelist(dst, src);
04558     
04559     for (con=dst->first, srccon=src->first; con && srccon; srccon=srccon->next, con=con->next) {
04560         bConstraintTypeInfo *cti= constraint_get_typeinfo(con);
04561         
04562         /* make a new copy of the constraint's data */
04563         con->data = MEM_dupallocN(con->data);
04564         
04565         /* only do specific constraints if required */
04566         if (cti) {
04567             /* perform custom copying operations if needed */
04568             if (cti->copy_data)
04569                 cti->copy_data(con, srccon);
04570             
04571             /* for proxies we don't want to make extern */
04572             if (do_extern) {
04573                 /* go over used ID-links for this constraint to ensure that they are valid for proxies */
04574                 if (cti->id_looper)
04575                     cti->id_looper(con, con_extern_cb, NULL);
04576             }
04577         }
04578     }
04579 }
04580 
04581 /* ......... */
04582 
04583 bConstraint *constraints_findByName(ListBase *list, const char *name)
04584 {
04585     return BLI_findstring(list, name, offsetof(bConstraint, name));
04586 }
04587 
04588 /* finds the 'active' constraint in a constraint stack */
04589 bConstraint *constraints_get_active (ListBase *list)
04590 {
04591     bConstraint *con;
04592     
04593     /* search for the first constraint with the 'active' flag set */
04594     if (list) {
04595         for (con= list->first; con; con= con->next) {
04596             if (con->flag & CONSTRAINT_ACTIVE)
04597                 return con;
04598         }
04599     }
04600     
04601     /* no active constraint found */
04602     return NULL;
04603 }
04604 
04605 /* Set the given constraint as the active one (clearing all the others) */
04606 void constraints_set_active (ListBase *list, bConstraint *con)
04607 {
04608     bConstraint *c;
04609     
04610     if (list) {
04611         for (c= list->first; c; c= c->next) {
04612             if (c == con) 
04613                 c->flag |= CONSTRAINT_ACTIVE;
04614             else 
04615                 c->flag &= ~CONSTRAINT_ACTIVE;
04616         }
04617     }
04618 }
04619 
04620 /* -------- Constraints and Proxies ------- */
04621 
04622 /* Rescue all constraints tagged as being CONSTRAINT_PROXY_LOCAL (i.e. added to bone that's proxy-synced in this file) */
04623 void extract_proxylocal_constraints (ListBase *dst, ListBase *src)
04624 {
04625     bConstraint *con, *next;
04626     
04627     /* for each tagged constraint, remove from src and move to dst */
04628     for (con= src->first; con; con= next) {
04629         next= con->next;
04630         
04631         /* check if tagged */
04632         if (con->flag & CONSTRAINT_PROXY_LOCAL) {
04633             BLI_remlink(src, con);
04634             BLI_addtail(dst, con);
04635         }
04636     }
04637 }
04638 
04639 /* Returns if the owner of the constraint is proxy-protected */
04640 short proxylocked_constraints_owner (Object *ob, bPoseChannel *pchan)
04641 {
04642     /* Currently, constraints can only be on object or bone level */
04643     if (ob && ob->proxy) {
04644         if (ob->pose && pchan) {
04645             bArmature *arm= ob->data;
04646             
04647             /* On bone-level, check if bone is on proxy-protected layer */
04648             if ((pchan->bone) && (pchan->bone->layer & arm->layer_protected))
04649                 return 1;
04650         }
04651         else {
04652             /* FIXME: constraints on object-level are not handled well yet */
04653             return 1;
04654         }   
04655     }
04656     
04657     return 0;
04658 }
04659 
04660 /* -------- Target-Matrix Stuff ------- */
04661 
04662 /* This function is a relic from the prior implementations of the constraints system, when all
04663  * constraints either had one or no targets. It used to be called during the main constraint solving
04664  * loop, but is now only used for the remaining cases for a few constraints. 
04665  *
04666  * None of the actual calculations of the matrices should be done here! Also, this function is
04667  * not to be used by any new constraints, particularly any that have multiple targets.
04668  */
04669 void get_constraint_target_matrix (struct Scene *scene, bConstraint *con, int n, short ownertype, void *ownerdata, float mat[][4], float ctime)
04670 {
04671     bConstraintTypeInfo *cti= constraint_get_typeinfo(con);
04672     ListBase targets = {NULL, NULL};
04673     bConstraintOb *cob;
04674     bConstraintTarget *ct;
04675     
04676     if (cti && cti->get_constraint_targets) {
04677         /* make 'constraint-ob' */
04678         cob= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bConstraintOb), "tempConstraintOb");
04679         cob->type= ownertype;
04680         cob->scene = scene;
04681         switch (ownertype) {
04682             case CONSTRAINT_OBTYPE_OBJECT: /* it is usually this case */
04683             {
04684                 cob->ob= (Object *)ownerdata;
04685                 cob->pchan= NULL;
04686                 if (cob->ob) {
04687                     copy_m4_m4(cob->matrix, cob->ob->obmat);
04688                     copy_m4_m4(cob->startmat, cob->matrix);
04689                 }
04690                 else {
04691                     unit_m4(cob->matrix);
04692                     unit_m4(cob->startmat);
04693                 }
04694             }   
04695                 break;
04696             case CONSTRAINT_OBTYPE_BONE: /* this may occur in some cases */
04697             {
04698                 cob->ob= NULL; /* this might not work at all :/ */
04699                 cob->pchan= (bPoseChannel *)ownerdata;
04700                 if (cob->pchan) {
04701                     copy_m4_m4(cob->matrix, cob->pchan->pose_mat);
04702                     copy_m4_m4(cob->startmat, cob->matrix);
04703                 }
04704                 else {
04705                     unit_m4(cob->matrix);
04706                     unit_m4(cob->startmat);
04707                 }
04708             }
04709                 break;
04710         }
04711         
04712         /* get targets - we only need the first one though (and there should only be one) */
04713         cti->get_constraint_targets(con, &targets);
04714         
04715         /* only calculate the target matrix on the first target */
04716         ct= (bConstraintTarget *)targets.first;
04717         while (ct && n-- > 0)
04718             ct= ct->next;
04719 
04720         if (ct) {
04721             if (cti->get_target_matrix)
04722                 cti->get_target_matrix(con, cob, ct, ctime);
04723             copy_m4_m4(mat, ct->matrix);
04724         }
04725         
04726         /* free targets + 'constraint-ob' */
04727         if (cti->flush_constraint_targets)
04728             cti->flush_constraint_targets(con, &targets, 1);
04729         MEM_freeN(cob);
04730     }
04731     else {
04732         /* invalid constraint - perhaps... */
04733         unit_m4(mat);
04734     }
04735 }
04736 
04737 /* Get the list of targets required for solving a constraint */
04738 void get_constraint_targets_for_solving (bConstraint *con, bConstraintOb *cob, ListBase *targets, float ctime)
04739 {
04740     bConstraintTypeInfo *cti= constraint_get_typeinfo(con);
04741     
04742     if (cti && cti->get_constraint_targets) {
04743         bConstraintTarget *ct;
04744         
04745         /* get targets 
04746          *  - constraints should use ct->matrix, not directly accessing values
04747          *  - ct->matrix members have not yet been calculated here! 
04748          */
04749         cti->get_constraint_targets(con, targets);
04750         
04751         /* set matrices 
04752          *  - calculate if possible, otherwise just initialize as identity matrix 
04753          */
04754         if (cti->get_target_matrix) {
04755             for (ct= targets->first; ct; ct= ct->next) 
04756                 cti->get_target_matrix(con, cob, ct, ctime);
04757         }
04758         else {
04759             for (ct= targets->first; ct; ct= ct->next)
04760                 unit_m4(ct->matrix);
04761         }
04762     }
04763 }
04764  
04765 /* ---------- Evaluation ----------- */
04766 
04767 /* This function is called whenever constraints need to be evaluated. Currently, all
04768  * constraints that can be evaluated are everytime this gets run.
04769  *
04770  * constraints_make_evalob and constraints_clear_evalob should be called before and 
04771  * after running this function, to sort out cob
04772  */
04773 void solve_constraints (ListBase *conlist, bConstraintOb *cob, float ctime)
04774 {
04775     bConstraint *con;
04776     float oldmat[4][4];
04777     float enf;
04778 
04779     /* check that there is a valid constraint object to evaluate */
04780     if (cob == NULL)
04781         return;
04782     
04783     /* loop over available constraints, solving and blending them */
04784     for (con= conlist->first; con; con= con->next) {
04785         bConstraintTypeInfo *cti= constraint_get_typeinfo(con);
04786         ListBase targets = {NULL, NULL};
04787         
04788         /* these we can skip completely (invalid constraints...) */
04789         if (cti == NULL) continue;
04790         if (con->flag & (CONSTRAINT_DISABLE|CONSTRAINT_OFF)) continue;
04791         /* these constraints can't be evaluated anyway */
04792         if (cti->evaluate_constraint == NULL) continue;
04793         /* influence == 0 should be ignored */
04794         if (con->enforce == 0.0f) continue;
04795         
04796         /* influence of constraint
04797          *  - value should have been set from animation data already
04798          */
04799         enf = con->enforce;
04800         
04801         /* make copy of worldspace matrix pre-constraint for use with blending later */
04802         copy_m4_m4(oldmat, cob->matrix);
04803         
04804         /* move owner matrix into right space */
04805         constraint_mat_convertspace(cob->ob, cob->pchan, cob->matrix, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_WORLD, con->ownspace);
04806         
04807         /* prepare targets for constraint solving */
04808         get_constraint_targets_for_solving(con, cob, &targets, ctime);
04809         
04810         /* Solve the constraint and put result in cob->matrix */
04811         cti->evaluate_constraint(con, cob, &targets);
04812         
04813         /* clear targets after use 
04814          *  - this should free temp targets but no data should be copied back
04815          *    as constraints may have done some nasty things to it...
04816          */
04817         if (cti->flush_constraint_targets) {
04818             cti->flush_constraint_targets(con, &targets, 1);
04819         }
04820         
04821         /* move owner back into worldspace for next constraint/other business */
04822         if ((con->flag & CONSTRAINT_SPACEONCE) == 0) 
04823             constraint_mat_convertspace(cob->ob, cob->pchan, cob->matrix, con->ownspace, CONSTRAINT_SPACE_WORLD);
04824             
04825         /* Interpolate the enforcement, to blend result of constraint into final owner transform 
04826          *  - all this happens in worldspace to prevent any weirdness creeping in ([#26014] and [#25725]),
04827          *    since some constraints may not convert the solution back to the input space before blending
04828          *    but all are guaranteed to end up in good "worldspace" result
04829          */
04830         /* Note: all kind of stuff here before (caused trouble), much easier to just interpolate, or did I miss something? -jahka */
04831         if (enf < 1.0f) {
04832             float solution[4][4];
04833             copy_m4_m4(solution, cob->matrix);
04834             blend_m4_m4m4(cob->matrix, oldmat, solution, enf);
04835         }
04836     }
04837 }
Generated on Tue Nov 13 2012 11:54:11 for Blender by  doxygen 1.7.4
